p.s: A fast database for constant data with memory sharing across processes
p.d: CHDB (constant hash database) is a fast key-value database for constant data, realized by using a memory-mapped file and thus providing the following functionalities: - Extremely fast initial load, regardless of the size of the database. - Only the pages of the file which are actually used are loaded from the disk. - Once a page is loaded it is shared across multiple processes. - Loaded pages are cached across multiple requests and even process recycling. A typical use of CHDB is as a faster alternative to defining many PHP constants. CHDB is internally implemented as a hash-table using a perfect hashing function, thus guaranteeing worst case O(1) lookup time.
